text: Geoffrey Muirden (2 October 1941 – 31 July 2006) was an author and secretary of the Australian Civil Liberties Union, which has been characterised as "one of Victoria's foremost racist and Holocaust denying organisations" and Australia's leading neo-Nazi group. He was also a supporter of Christian Identity and believed that there was an international Jewish conspiracy". Muirden graduated with honors from the University of Melbourne in the arts and subsequently worked for the Victorian Department of Education in various senior roles. He was acting director of the Adelaide Institute in 1999. He wrote numerous articles on historical and political topics, particularly those of a contentious nature. ==References== ==External links== * Australian Civil Liberties Union Category:1941 births Category:2006 deaths Category:Australian Holocaust deniers Category:Antisemitism in Australia Category:Australian people of Scottish descent Category:University of Melbourne alumni
